ENCOURAGE BIRTH COMPANION TO BE PRESENT AT BIRTH
Birth companions provide support to the mother during labour, childbirth, and in the post-
partum period. They can also help to recognize danger signs, alert the health-care worker in 
case of emergency, and care for the baby. Examples of possible birth companions are family 
members, the spouse, friends, community health workers, doulas, or staff members.
Evidence shows that birth companions can help to improve health outcomes. The pres-
